tags.title: Technical Vision and Strategy
tags.description: Establish and execute a cohesive technical strategy for frontend systems to align with business goals and enable scalable growth.

tags.title: User Experience and Accessibility
tags.description: Create intuitive, accessible, and high-performing user interfaces to improve customer satisfaction and engagement.

tags.title: Quality Code and Scalable Systems
tags.description: Ensure code quality, maintainability, and scalability to meet current and future business needs.

tags.title: Mentoring and Supporting Team Growth
tags.description: Actively mentor team members to develop technical skills, foster collaboration, and improve team performance.

tags.title: Cross-Functional Collaboration
tags.description: Collaborate with product, design, and backend teams to deliver seamless solutions that meet business objectives.

tags.title: Innovation
tags.description: Proactively identify opportunities to leverage new technologies and approaches that can enhance competitive advantage.

tags.title: Security and Compliance
tags.description: Safeguard frontend systems against vulnerabilities and ensure compliance with organisational and regulatory standards.

tags.title: Metrics and Continuous Improvement
tags.description: Measure, analyse, and improve frontend systems to optimise business outcomes.

tasks.description: Conduct stakeholder interviews to gather business requirements and align the frontend technical strategy
Define a performance budget for frontend applications, including metrics like load time and interaction speed, by analysing historical user data
Develop and document a frontend architecture roadmap that supports scalability and aligns with organisational goals
Evaluate emerging technologies quarterly for potential alignment with business needs and present findings during strategy meetings
Create a reusable component library and ensure its adoption across teams to reduce development time and maintain consistency
Audit existing applications for accessibility compliance (e.g., WCAG 2.1 AA) and create an improvement plan
Collaborate with UX designers to implement user feedback into the frontend designs
Develop and test responsive designs to ensure compatibility across devices and browsers
Perform usability testing sessions with cross-functional teams to identify and address pain points in user workflows
Optimise frontend performance to meet the defined performance budget, reducing page load times by X%
Conduct code reviews for team members, ensuring adherence to coding standards and best practices
Write automated tests for 90% of new features, with a focus on unit, integration, and end-to-end tests
Refactor legacy code to align with modern best practices, prioritising systems that impact business-critical workflows
Document technical decisions and coding guidelines in a shared repository to improve onboarding and development efficiency
Monitor application errors and bugs using tools like Sentry or New Relic, and resolve critical issues
Host bi-weekly technical workshops or code labs to upskill team members on new technologies or strategies
Provide structured feedback during performance reviews, identifying areas of growth and creating development plans for each team member
Pair program with junior developers twice per sprint to enhance their understanding of complex frontend concepts
Create documentation on best practices and distribute it to team members during onboarding sessions
Identify training opportunities and recommend courses, conferences, or certifications to team members
Participate in sprint planning meetings to provide technical insights and effort estimates for frontend tasks
Work with backend engineers to define APIs and ensure data integration requirements are met for project deliverables
Provide technical feedback on design mockups and prototypes to ensure feasibility and alignment with frontend capabilities
Document and share frontend dependencies and technical requirements with cross-functional teams before the start of development
Host weekly sync meetings with product and design teams to address blockers and ensure alignment on project goals
Research industry trends and produce a quarterly report on emerging frontend technologies with actionable recommendations
Develop proof-of-concept projects for innovative ideas and present outcomes to stakeholders
Collaborate with analytics teams to identify user behavior insights and propose frontend changes to improve engagement metrics
Create internal hackathons or innovation sessions to encourage experimentation and generate new ideas
Develop a plan for integrating AI/ML tools into frontend development processes where applicable (e.g., predictive UI)
Implement secure coding practices and train team members to follow OWASP guidelines during feature development
Perform quarterly security audits of frontend code to identify and mitigate vulnerabilities
Collaborate with the security team to ensure frontend applications meet compliance standards (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA)
Utilise tools for dependency scanning (e.g., Snyk or GitHub Dependabot) and address critical security issues
Develop a disaster recovery plan for frontend systems to ensure business continuity during security incidents
Define KPIs and benchmarks for frontend performance in collaboration with stakeholders
Set up analytics tracking for frontend features to measure user engagement and feature adoption rates
Analyse A/B test results quarterly and provide actionable recommendations to improve conversion rates and user experience
Monitor frontend performance metrics (e.g., page load times, interaction times) and implement optimisation strategies to meet goals
Conduct retrospectives with the team after each sprint to identify and implement improvements in frontend processes

tasks2.description: Conduct stakeholder interviews to gather business requirements and align the frontend technical strategy by the end of Q1.
Define a frontend performance budget (e.g., page load must be under 2 seconds) by the end of the first sprint.
Develop a roadmap for implementing new frontend technologies with quarterly milestones to improve user experience.
Audit the current frontend architecture and document inefficiencies by the end of the current quarter.
Collaborate with product managers and backend teams to set quarterly OKRs focused on frontend deliverables.
Optimize core web vitals (e.g., Largest Contentful Paint under 2.5s, First Input Delay under 100ms) for all pages within the next 3 months.
Analyze and reduce JavaScript bundle size by 20% by refactoring code and implementing code-splitting techniques within 6 weeks.
Implement lazy loading for images and third-party scripts on all pages within the next sprint.
Migrate 80% of legacy CSS to a modern CSS framework (e.g., Tailwind or CSS-in-JS) within the next quarter.
Set up monitoring to track frontend performance metrics (e.g., TTI, TBT) on a monthly basis using tools like Lighthouse or New Relic.
Conduct usability testing with 10 users and deliver a report with actionable insights by the end of the quarter.
Implement dark mode functionality for the website or app within 2 sprints and measure user engagement metrics pre- and post-implementation.
Collaborate with the design team to implement a responsive design framework that works seamlessly across 5 device breakpoints by the next release cycle.
Perform accessibility audits using tools like Axe and Lighthouse and address 90% of high-priority issues in the next quarter.
Implement a feedback collection mechanism (e.g., survey tool or feedback button) to gather user input on new features by the end of the sprint.
Establish a code review process to ensure 100% of pull requests are reviewed within 2 business days.
Implement a style guide for consistent coding practices and ensure 90% adherence by the end of Q2.
Refactor 50% of the existing codebase to improve readability, remove redundancies, and reduce technical debt by the end of the quarter.
Set up automated linting and formatting tools to enforce code quality standards by the next sprint.
Conduct monthly knowledge-sharing sessions to ensure the team is up to date with the latest frontend best practices.
Onboard new team members and ensure they complete the onboarding plan within their first 30 days.
Mentor 2 junior developers on coding best practices and career development during biweekly one-on-one sessions for the next 6 months.
Conduct quarterly workshops to teach new frontend technologies or frameworks to the team.
Create and maintain documentation for key frontend systems, ensuring 100% team access and understanding by the end of the current quarter.
Lead 3 code pairing sessions per sprint to upskill team members and improve collaboration.
Develop and share frontend technical documentation with the backend and QA teams by the end of the current sprint.
Participate in biweekly cross-functional team meetings to align on development priorities and dependencies.
Set up and manage a shared design system in collaboration with the UX/UI team by the end of Q2.
Work with QA teams to ensure 100% of frontend features are tested using automated and manual testing frameworks.
Collaborate with product management to prioritize and deliver at least 90% of major features within agreed-upon deadlines.
Implement client-side caching for reusable API calls to reduce network requests by 30% within 2 sprints.
Set up server-side rendering (SSR) for key pages to improve SEO rankings and reduce time-to-first-byte (TTFB) by 25% in the next quarter.
Develop reusable components for 70% of commonly used UI elements (e.g., buttons, modals) within the next release cycle.
Implement a state management solution (e.g., Redux, Zustand) for 100% of complex state-dependent features by the end of Q3.
Set up a CI/CD pipeline for seamless deployment of frontend updates with a maximum downtime of 1% by the end of Q1.
Propose and implement 3 A/B tests per quarter to improve UI/UX design and measure conversion rates.
Research and prototype one new frontend technology or library per quarter to evaluate its potential for adoption.
Deploy feature flags for 100% of major features to allow for incremental rollouts and testing.
Collaborate with data analysts to analyze user behavior and generate actionable insights within 2 weeks of feature launches.
Partner with the product team to identify and prioritize 5 innovative features to experiment with by the end of the year.
